intro: Protium heptaphyllum var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered sycamore, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces large, round fruits that contain a single, hard-shelled seed. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
